RelatedSentence: The inquests , which began in 1194 and also exist in some former British colonies , allow a public hearing into deaths of the famous -- such as Princess Diana and Russian businessman Boris Berezovsky -- and ordinary citizens alike .

( JPM ) information technology vice president , who died after falling from the lender 's London headquarters in January , the third hearing into a bank worker 's death in the British capital in six months .
